meanings.definition: The quality of being unable to be appeased or pacified.
meanings.sent1: Her implacabilities towards criticism made it challenging to provide feedback.
meanings.sent2: The implacabilities of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent3: Despite his implacabilities, he couldn't resist a good joke now and then.
meanings.sent4: The implacabilities of time march on, indifferent to our desires.
meanings.sent5: The implacabilities of the mountain stood firm against any attempts to move it.

meanings.definition: The state of being relentless or unyielding.
meanings.sent1: The implacabilities of the detective led to the solving of the case.
meanings.sent2: In the face of danger, her implacabilities shone through, never backing down.
meanings.sent3: The implacabilities of the toddler's tantrum were surprisingly adorable.
meanings.sent4: His implacabilities in negotiations earned him a reputation for being tough.
meanings.sent5: The implacabilities of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
